Initial support for building against 10.11 SDK

- Exception rules in Info.plist to allow loading stuff from various internet
  domains
- No longer using resource protocol as WebKit in 10.11 prohibits this
- No longer loading main.js from remote web server as WebKit in 10.11
  prohibits HTTP loads in HTTPS contexts
- Injects main.js via embedded data URL (instead of via resource: or http:)
Convert the project to use Xcode 7 and build against SDK 10.11 (can be built against SDK 10.9 or 10.10 as well) Still targets 10.10

Changes to build configuration

Targets SDK 10.10 explicitly, as 10.11 is soon released and we want to support OS X >=10.10.

Fixes a bug where typing input is out of order

Bug:
  Typing the following sequence:
  "a|"
  "a |"
  "a |b" -- cursor jumps to LHS of inserted character
  "a c|b"
  "a c |b"
  "a c d|b" -- again, and so on

  Introduced by: 98c689bbe9f59b5e17b97461c2b2e89538cff1d7

Adds config for hiding traffic light and controlling autoreload

Defaults key "autoreload" can be set to a positive fractional number-of-seconds to enable automatic reloading of messenger.com while the app is not active (screensaver running, screen locked, app hidden, app in background, app minimized, etc). A zero or negative value, or absence of a value causes autoreload to be disabled.

Defaults key "traffic-lights/disable" can be set to boolean YES to hide the window controls (close, minimize, zoom).

Adds automatic background reloading of messenger.com, useful when the app is not manually restarted or reloaded. The strategy is to reload messenger.com when the app is in the background or hidden (or while the computer is locked or displaying a screensaver.) A timer is used to wait for a certain amount of time to avoid reloading immediately when the app is 'backgrounded' as well as not reloading it too often. It's currently set to reload every 15 minutes, where the act of reloading only happens after at least 4 seconds of the app being continuosly 'backgrounded'.

readme
Ignores "about" URL open requests. Closes #129, closes #126

Add Paste Image Support

Since WebView is weird and doesn't support pasting image data directly (the javascript file dataTransfer event is blank), and you can't really fake a dataTransfer event, one would try pasting an image but it wouldn't do anything.

However, since the fact that drag + drop does work (yay!), we can synthesize a fake drag + drop session anytime someone attempts to paste an image. If the image is on the local filesystem it'll just upload whatever it's given, but if it's clipboard data, it'll convert it to PNG and then upload that.

If the pasteboard just contains text (or anything other than an image), original pasting functionality is performed.

Yay for fake drag + drop!

This code was originally based on fixing the first character input beep, but since there appears to be no side effect of manually creating all input events this would fix #97. This other solution would be to extend the `window.getSelection()` check to be something like `(window.getSelection().baseOffset === 0 || window.getSelection().focusOffset === 0)` but it’s starting to look fragile.

UI updates

- Window buttons are always be visible, matched to the position of Safari 8.0 on OS X 10.10.3.
- Entire top of window (~50pt) can now be used to move the window. Closes #40
- "gear" icon hidden and the various items in the settings menu has moved to the app menu:
  - "Settings" moved to: Messenger > Preferences...
  - "About" moved to: Messenger > About Messenger
  - "Help" moved to: Help > Messenger Help
  - "Terms" moved to: Help > Terms
  - "Privacy Policy" moved to: Help > Privacy Policy
  - "Log Out" moved to: Messenger > Log Out...
- Cmd-N linked to "new conversation"
- Adds fullscreen mode. Closes #43
